_copyright_notice: This file is part of the 'Regular Expression Integer Inequalities' library.
Please see the corresponding files in the library for license information.
_manual_test_comment: These are manually written / proofread test cases. Strings are comments.
Elements are the five arguments to re_int_ineq followed by the expected output.
manual_tests: with allint=false these two are simply >0
for n=0 these are shorter than negative lookahead
no anchor (these are just a few tests selected from the large set above) TODO: more
_extraction_comment: Tests for checking the extraction of integers from strings using the generated regexps. Strings are comments.
Elements are the five arguments to re_int_ineq, the search string, followed by the expected result(s).
extraction: The 42 quick brown foxes jumped over the 47 lazy dogs.
repeat of all of the above test cases but with no spaces in string
repeat of all of the above tests with zeroes=true and additionally 47 (leading zeroes) instead of 42 (no leading zeroes)
_aroundzero_comment: Cases that will be inspected for their behavior in regards to '0'.
Elements are the operator, integer, and whether the generated regex should match 0 and -0.
The number of negative cases in the array should match the number of positive cases!
_errorcases_comment: Arguments to re_int_ineq that should cause errors. Strings are comments.
_zeroes_comment: Cases that will be inspected for their behavior in regards to leading zeroes.
_testranges_comment: Integers in these ranges will be tested against each other in regex generation and matching.
Don't make the ranges too large or the tests will take too long.
Starting point inclusive, ending point exclusive. 'allint' cases will be mirrored.
